intro: Limodorum unguiculatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lily of the valley, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asparagaceae. It is characterized by its slender, strap-like leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped white flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia, this plant thrives in cool, moist environments. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread slowly through underground stems. The plant is often found in shaded woodlands and is noted for its fragrant blooms that appear in late spring.
